intro: Dictyostega schomburgkii var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered dictyostega, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
